description:
Far-right lawmakers have spread false narratives about the state of Brazilian democracy, trying to skew U.S. lawmakers’ perception of the country

The post Brazilian democracy may be flawed, but it is not on the brink appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazilian democracy may be flawed, but it is not on the brink

description:
Shein, AliExpress, and Shopee have become ubiquitous in Brazil, causing much controversy along the way. Now, a bid from domestic retailers to bump up taxes on these platforms seems to have taken hold

The post Explaining Brazil #295: Taxing the tops appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Explaining Brazil #295: Taxing the tops

description:
The Brazilian unemployment rate has remained stable in the moving quarter through April at 7.5 percent — slightly lower than the 7.6 percent measured in the previous rolling quarter.  Adriana Beringuy, coordinator of household sample surveys at the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics, says the April figures show “a stabilization of unemployment,” mainly driven […]

The post Brazil’s employed population breaks new record appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazil’s employed population breaks new record

description:
At a conference chaired by Brazil, the 193 member states of the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO), part of the United Nations system, approved on May 24, by consensus, its Treaty on Intellectual Property, Genetic Resources, and Associated Traditional Knowledge. Once it enters into force with 15 contracting parties, the new regulation will require patent […]

The post Brazil helps approve treaty on indigenous rights in patent systems appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazil helps approve treaty on indigenous rights in patent systems
